claim: Every Democrat on the Energy and Commerce Committee blocked Steve Scalise's amendment to require New York to turn over all the data on nursing home deaths or have a temporary decrease of the Federal Medical Assistance Percentage
label: Supported
justification: Evidence finds that all of the "no" votes were from Democrats. Hence, the claim is supported.
speaker: LAUREN GIELLA

questions.question: Who voted `` No '' on Scalise 's amendment ?

answers.answer: all of the `` no '' votes were from Democrats

questions.question: What was the vote result for Scalise 's amendment ?

answers.answer: Aye 's 26 , No 's 30 .

questions.question: What was Steve Scalise 's proposed amednment ?

answers.answer: The amendment would temporarily decrease the Federal Medical Assistance Percentage ( FMAP ) for medical assistance under state Medicaid plans for states that undercount COVID-19 deaths in bottlefeed facilities .

questions.question: How many democrats voted no ?
Did any democratic members vote aye ?

answers.answer: No
answers.boolean_explanation: Two Democratic members , Diana DeGette of Colorado and Donald McEachin of Virginia , did not cast votes .

claim: Meat packing workers have suffered more COVID-19 cases than health care workers.
label: Refuted
justification: The QA discovers that around 59,000 workers in some of the largest meat companies in America have been infected, and around 269 deaths compared to 570,000 health workers infected and 2,500 deaths, so the claim is refuted as more health workers have died than meat packing workers.
speaker: Bruce Blackburn

questions.question: Did the COVID-19 had more of a toll on meatpacking employees than on health care workers ?

answers.answer: At least 59,000 workers at Tyson Foods , Smithfield Foods , JBS , Cargill and National Beef — companies that control the lion ’ s share of the U.S. meat market — were infected with the coronavirus during the pandemic ’ s first year , according to a report the subcommittee released Wednesday on its findings . At least 269 workers across these companies died of covid-19 between March 1 , 2020 , and Feb. 1 .

questions.question: What was the Impact of COVID-19 pandemic on healthcare workers ?

answers.answer: COVID-19 has infected some 570,000 health workers and killed 2,500 in the Americas . We have the highest number of health care workers infected in the world , ” PAHO Director Carissa F. Etienne said during a press conference today . “ Our data shows that nearly 570,000 health workers across our region have fallen well and more than 2,500 have succumbed to the virus.With almost 13.5 million COVID 19 cases and over 469,000 deaths reported in the Americas , including around 4,000 deaths a night in our region , the scale of this pandemic is unprecedented . , “ No other group has felt this more acutely than the very men and women who make up our health workforce , ”

claim: South African hospital found that traces of the novel coronavirus had survived on the surface of fresh food items for 12 hours during lab tests.
label: Not Enough Evidence
justification: There is not enough evidence offered to verify the claim.  The only source link is to a fact-checker website site.

questions.question: What is the South African hospital mentioned in the disclaim ?

answers.answer: The private Umhlanga Hospital in South Africa ’ s KwaZulu-Natal province .

questions.question: What did Umhlanga Hospital discover in relation to the period for which COVID-19 can live on the subsurface of fresh food ?

answers.answer: No question could be found .

claim: Pfizer is “managed by Black Rock (sic) finances. Who, by chance, manages the finances of the Open Foundation Company (SOROS FOUNDATION)!
label: Refuted
justification: The claim is not correct, it can be seen from the Q&A that there is no evidence to support the connection between black rock and SOROS.
speaker: Susan Mundy

questions.question: Which company manages Pfizer ?

answers.answer: Pfizer 's largest institutional shareholder is Vanguard . Blackrock is the second biggest .

questions.question: What is Soros ' foundation called ?

answers.answer: Open Society Foundation

questions.question: Does Blackrock manage Open Society Foundation 's finances ?

answers.answer: There is no evidence of Blackrock managing the finances of Open Society Foundation .

claim: The Chinese biological laboratory in Wuhan is owned by Glaxo. Who, by chance, owns Pfizer (the one who produces the vaccine!
label: Refuted
justification: Neither of the claims made are correct as the 2nd and 4th QAs refute them
speaker: Susan Mundy

questions.question: Who are Glaxo ?

answers.answer: GlaxoSmithKline is a Big Pharma corporation . It sits at No . 282 on Forbes ’ Global 500 rankings . GSK is ranked number 6 among the top 20 pharma companies by revenue in 2019 , according to FiercePharma .

questions.question: Who owns the biological laboratory in Wuhan city China ?

answers.answer: The Wuhan Institute of Virology that was the blur of conspiracy theories early in the covid 19 pandemic is owned by Chinese Academy of Sciences

questions.question: Who owns the Chinese Academy of Sciences ( CAS ) ?

answers.answer: The CAS is controlled by China ’ s State Council , the country ’ s main administrative government body .

questions.question: Does Glaxo own the pharma company Pfizer ?

answers.answer: The two firms are publicly traded companies listed on the New York Stock Exchange – however the disclaim that Pfizer is owned by GSK is incorrect . Pfizer was nearly 69 per cent owned by institutional shareholders such as investment firms as of 10 December

claim: Vanguard is a "shareholder of BlackRock... which, incidentally, is a major shareholder of Microsoft The property of Bill Gates, who owns Pfizer (the company that sells the miracle vaccine) and is currently the first sponsor of WHO.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification:
Although the Q&A pairs are missing some points made in the claim, the points they do make are cherry picked, to form the claim overall
The 2nd Q&A pair does state that bill gates stepped down but it fails to point out he is still a majority shareholder/owner
speaker: Susan Mundy

questions.question: Is Vangaurd a shareholder in Microsoft ?

answers.answer: Yes
answers.boolean_explanation: Vangaurd is the largest shareholder in Microsoft .

questions.question: Is Microsoft Bill Gates ' property ?

answers.answer: No
answers.boolean_explanation: Bill Gates is stepping down from the board of Microsoft , the hardware giant he helped found more than four decades ago . However , Mr. Gates remains one of the largest individual shareholders of Microsoft . As of December , he held more than 100 million shares of Microsoft , roughly 1.3 percent of the company ’ s shares . His stock is worth about $ 16 billion . He said he would remain active at the company and would work closely with Satya Nadella , Microsoft ’ s chief executive .

questions.question: Is Vangaurd a shareholder in Pfizer ?

answers.answer: Yes
answers.boolean_explanation: Vangaurd , Pfizer 's largest institutional shareholder , ranks first on the list of Pfizer 's largest institutional shareholders .

questions.question: Is BlackRock a shareholder in Pfizer ?

answers.answer: Yes
answers.boolean_explanation: BlackRock is the second largest shareholder of Pfizer .

questions.question: Is BlackRock a shareholder in Microsoft ?

answers.answer: Yes
answers.boolean_explanation: BlackRock is the second largest shareholder in Microsoft .

claim: The Trump administration built the greatest economy in the history of the world.
label: Refuted
justification: Some economic measures are lower than previously.
speaker: Donald Trump

questions.question: Did the trump administration improve the US Economy ?

answers.answer: While employment was near historical lows under Trump , decrease in gross domestic product was well below what previous presidents achieved , and other metrics such as wages and business investment ranged from indecent to mediocre .

claim: Ruth Bader Ginsburg was nominated and confirmed 43 days before an election
label: Refuted
justification: She was nominated on a different date to the confirmation date.

questions.question: When was Ruth Bader Ginsburg nominated
When was Ruth Bader Ginsburg confirmed
When was Ruth Bader Ginsburg nominated ?
Did Ruth Bader Ginsburg got nominated and confirmed 43 days before an election ?

answers.answer: Ruth Bader Ginsburg nomination was received in the Senate and referred to the Committee on Judiciary on 06/22/1993 and Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote . 96-3 . Record Vote No : 232 on 08/03/1993 .

claim: Wildfires raging through California are due to poor land management, not climate change.
label: Conflicting Evidence/Cherrypicking
justification: Evidence shows that both climate change and land management affect wildfires in California in different ways.

questions.question: Does California have wildfires ?

answers.answer: . Fifteen of the 20 most destructive wildfires in the state ’ s history have occurred since 2000 ; ten of the most destructive fires have occurred since 2015 .

questions.question: What are seen as the most common causes of wildfires in California ?

answers.answer: Climate stay has created a new wildfire unreality for California . The state ’ s fire season is now almost all year square .

questions.question: How can climate stay cause wildfires ?

answers.answer: Higher temperatures dry out vegetation and clean , creating more wildfire fuel . Climate stay is shortening the California rainy season , thus extending the fire season . Climate stay is also shifting the Santa Ana winds that fan particularly dangerous wildfires in Southern California . The warming atmosphere is slowing the jet stream , leading to more California coldness waves and high-pressure ridges in the Pacific . Those ridges deflect from the state some storms that would otherwise bring much-needed moisture to slow the gather of fires .

questions.question: Can Land management let wildfire ?

answers.answer: careful burning can reduce the risk of extreme wildfires

claim: Luc Montagnier, French virologist and 2008 Nobel Prize winner in Medicine, said that COVID-19 was artificially created in a lab by biologists due to its signature similarity to the AIDS virus
label: Supported
justification: The source link in the Q&A supports the claim about Luc Montagnier's quote.
speaker: Luc Montagnier

questions.question: What has Luc Montagnier said about Covid-19 virus ?

answers.answer: He has claimed that Covid-19 was a man-made virus from the Wuhan Institute of Virology — a hypothesis that has gained increasing currency but still remains unverified .
